answers.answer: Hi,How is your father? Generally, a high serum creatinine level suggests  that the kidneys are not working well.  Temporary  increase may also be observed if  patient is dehydrated, has low blood volume, eats a large amount of meat or take certain medications. A confirmatory test  may need to be done and and it is important to control any conditions that may be contributing to the damage also such as hypertension or diabetes. It is best that you discuss the results with his attending physician. Regular monitoring of his blood sugar is highly recommended. Take care and do keep us posted.
